title: Express the function
text: We must first express the graphs as functions of $$y$$. The curve on the left can be represented by the function $$x=\sqrt{y}$$. The curve on the right can be represented by the funcgion $$x=2-y$$.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Change the limits
text: Now we have to determine the limits of integration. The region is bounded below by the x-axis, so the lower limit of integration is $$y=0$$.

title: Change the limits
text: The region is bounded below by the x-axis, so the lower limit of integration is $$y=0$$. The upper limit of integration is determined by the point where the two graphs intersect, which is the point $$(1,1)$$ so the upper limit of integration is $$y=1$$.
